properties.label: Project ID
properties.name: projectId
properties.description: Google Cloud Project ID, which uniquely identifies your project. You can find it on the Dashboard in the Cloud Platform Console. If the system is running on Google Cloud Platform, this can be left blank or set to 'auto-detect' and the system's project id will be used.

properties.label: Creator Service Account Key
properties.name: accountKey
properties.description: Service account key used to create Dataproc clusters. Paste the contents of the service account key JSON file that you can download from the service accounts section under IAM and admin on the Cloud Console. If the system is running on Google Cloud Platform, this can be left blank or set to 'auto-detect' and the system's credentials will be used.

properties.label: Region
properties.name: region
properties.description: Regions are collections of zones. Zones have high-bandwidth, low-latency network connections to other zones in the same region. For more information, refer to https://cloud.google.com/compute/docs/regions-zones/. If the system is running on Google Cloud Platform, this can be set to 'auto-detect' and the system's region will be used.

properties.label: Zone
properties.name: zone
properties.description: A zone is an isolated location within a region. The fully-qualified name for a zone is made up of <region>-<zone>. For example, the fully-qualified name for zone a in region us-central1 is us-central1-a. For more information, refer to https://cloud.google.com/compute/docs/regions-zones/. If the system is running on Google Cloud Platform, this can be set to 'auto-detect' and the system's zone will be used.

properties.label: Network
properties.name: network
properties.description: Select a VPC network in the specified project to use when creating clusters with this profile. If this is left blank or set to 'auto-detect', a network from the project will be chosen.

properties.label: Network Host Project ID
properties.name: networkHostProjectId
properties.description: Google Cloud Project ID, which uniquely identifies the project where the network resides. This can be left blank if the network resides in the same project as specified in the Project ID. In case of Shared VPC this must be set to the host project ID where the network resides.

properties.label: Subnet
properties.name: subnet
properties.description: Subnet to use when creating clusters. The subnet must be within the given network, and it must be for the same region that the zone is in. If this is left blank, a subnet will automatically be chosen based on the network and zone.

properties.label: Runner Service Account
properties.name: serviceAccount
properties.description: Name of the service account of the Dataproc virtual machines (VM) that are used to run programs. If none is given, the default Compute Engine service account will be used.

properties.label: Number of masters
properties.name: masterNumNodes
properties.description: Master nodes contain the YARN Resource Manager, HDFS NameNode, and all job drivers

properties.label: Master Machine Type
properties.name: masterMachineType
properties.description: The type of master machine to use

properties.label: Master Cores
properties.name: masterCPUs
properties.description: The number of virtual cores to allocate to a master node

properties.label: Master Memory (GB)
properties.name: masterMemoryMB
properties.description: The amount of memory in GB to allocate for a master node

properties.label: Master Disk Size (GB)
properties.name: masterDiskGB
properties.description: The disk size in GB to allocate for a master node

properties.label: Master Disk Type
properties.name: masterDiskType
properties.description: The type of boot disk for a master node

properties.label: Worker Machine Type
properties.name: workerMachineType
properties.description: The type of worker machine to use

properties.label: Worker Cores
properties.name: workerCPUs
properties.description: The number of virtual cores to allocate for worker nodes

properties.label: Worker Memory (GB)
properties.name: workerMemoryMB
properties.description: The amount of memory in GB to allocate for a worker node

properties.label: Worker Disk Size (GB)
properties.name: workerDiskGB
properties.description: The disk size in GB to allocate for a worker node

properties.label: Worker Disk Type
properties.name: workerDiskType
properties.description: The type of boot disk for a worker node

properties.label: Use predefined Autoscaling
properties.name: enablePredefinedAutoScaling
properties.description: Automates cluster resource management for processing. This is a recommended autoscaling policy.

properties.label: Number of primary workers
properties.name: workerNumNodes
properties.description: Worker nodes contain a YARN NodeManager and a HDFS DataNode.

properties.label: Number of secondary workers
properties.name: secondaryWorkerNumNodes
properties.description: Secondary worker nodes contain a YARN NodeManager but not a HDFS DataNode. This is normally set to 0 unless an autoscale policy requires it to be higher.

properties.label: Autoscaling policy
properties.name: autoScalingPolicy
properties.description: Specify the Autoscaling Policy id (name) or the resource URI

properties.label: Metadata
properties.name: clusterMetaData
properties.description: Add additional metadata for instances that run in your cluster. You can typically use it for tracking billing and chargebacks. For more details, see https://cloud.google.com/dataproc/docs/concepts/configuring-clusters/metadata

properties.name: networkTags
properties.label: Network Tags
properties.description: Assign Network tags to apply firewall rules to specific nodes of cluster. Network tags must start with a lowercase letter and can contain lowercase letters, numbers, and hyphens. Tags must end with a lowercase letter or number.

properties.label: Enable Secure Boot
properties.name: secureBootEnabled
properties.description: Defines whether the Dataproc VMs have Secure Boot enabled.

properties.label: Enable vTPM
properties.name: vTpmEnabled
properties.description: Defines whether the Dataproc VMs have the virtual Trusted Platform Module (vTPM) enabled.

properties.label: Enable Integrity Monitoring
properties.name: integrityMonitoringEnabled
properties.description: Defines whether Dataproc VMs have integrity monitoring enabled.

properties.label: Image Version
properties.name: imageVersion
properties.description: The Dataproc image version. If none is given, one will automatically be chosen. If Custom Image URI is specified, this field will be ignored.

properties.label: Custom Image URI
properties.name: customImageUri
properties.description: Dataproc Image URI. If the URI is unspecified, it will be inferred from Image Version.

properties.label: GCS Bucket
properties.name: gcsBucket
properties.description: Google Cloud Storage bucket used to stage job dependencies and config files for running pipelines in Google Cloud Dataproc

properties.label: Encryption Key Name
properties.name: encryptionKeyName
properties.description: The GCP customer managed encryption key (CMEK) name used by Cloud Dataproc

properties.name: initActions
properties.label: Initialization Actions
properties.description: A list of scripts to be executed during initialization of cluster. Init actions should be placed on Google Cloud Storage.

properties.label: Cluster Properties
properties.name: clusterProperties
properties.description: Cluster properties used to override default configuration properties for the Hadoop services. For example, the default Spark parallelism can be overriden by setting a value for spark:spark.default.parallelism. See https://cloud.google.com/dataproc/docs/concepts/configuring-clusters/cluster-properties for more information.

properties.label: Labels
properties.name: clusterLabels
properties.description: Specifies labels for the Dataproc cluster being created.

properties.label: Max Idle Time
properties.name: idleTTL
properties.description: Configure Dataproc to delete the cluster if it has been idle for longer than this many minutes. Clusters are normally deleted directly after a run ends, but this delete may fail in rare situations. For example, if permissions are revoked in the middle of a run, or if there is a Dataproc outage. Use this to ensure that clusters are eventually deleted even if the instance is unable to delete the cluster for any reason.

properties.label: Skip Cluster Delete
properties.name: skipDelete
properties.description: Whether to skip cluster deletion at the end of a run. Clusters will need to be deleted manually. This should only be used when debugging a failed run.

properties.label: Enable Stackdriver Logging Integration
properties.name: stackdriverLoggingEnabled
properties.description: Enable or disable Stackdriver logging integration.

properties.label: Enable Stackdriver Monitoring Integration
properties.name: stackdriverMonitoringEnabled
properties.description: Enable or disable Stackdriver monitoring integration.

properties.label: Enable Component Gateway
properties.name: componentGatewayEnabled
properties.description: Enable Component Gateway to allow access to cluster UIs like the YARN ResourceManager and Spark HistoryServer.

properties.label: Prefer External IP
properties.name: preferExternalIP
properties.description: When the system is running on Google Cloud Platform in the same network as the cluster, it will normally use the internal IP when communicating with the cluster. Set this to always use the external IP.

properties.label: Create Poll Delay
properties.name: pollCreateDelay
properties.description: The number of seconds to wait after creating a cluster to begin polling to see if it has been created

properties.label: Create Poll Jitter
properties.name: pollCreateJitter
properties.description: Maximum amount of jitter in seconds to add to the delay for polling for cluster creation

properties.label: Delete Poll Delay
properties.name: pollDeleteDelay
properties.description: The number of seconds to wait after deleting a cluster to begin polling to see if it has been deleted

properties.label: Poll Interval
properties.name: pollInterval
properties.description: The number of seconds to wait in between polls for cluster status during create and delete operations
